Green Beans: Tossed in garlic and oyster sauce, these were lip smacking delicious. Plus the green beans had a nice crunch too it... if you have to get a vegetable side dish, I'd recommend this.

Peking Duck Steamed Buns (comes with 3): I dislike duck... but was curious so we ordered it. And damn, it was delicious. The duck came out piping hot but the skin was so crispy and the meat was moist and flavorful. When eating these, the steamed buns come separately, so you stuff them with the peking duck, hoisin sauce, and a little bit of green onion. Fun and delicious experience, this dish really surprised me. Keep in mind that availability is limited so be sure to ask!

Pork Steamed Buns (comes with 3): Similar to the Peking Duck, the steamed buns are folded like a taco with the fillings inside. The pork is very tasty, albeit there was quite a bit of fat on our portion. The shiitake mushrooms are so meaty and delicious. My only complaint with this dish is that the amount of meat in each bun was very inconsistent - in fact one of the buns had mostly mushrooms and no pork!

Chubby Chow Mein: This exceeded my expectations... I'm used to chow mein just being salty and fried. This had a very rich chicken flavor, which was quite appealing. Noodles had a good bite to them and it was delicious with the veggies. I recommend ordering this as a side dish!

Salt and Pepper Shrimp: As others have mentioned, these were good but very typical - lightly tempura-style fried shrimp with a very garlicky flavor. They come with some chipotle aioli dipping sauce (that's my assumption) that goes well. The portion and shrimp are small so easy to share between 2 people.

Kung Pao Wings: Good, but I wish they were crispy! The sauce on the wings has a spicy sweetness to it that's addicting, but it's too bad the skin on the wings wasn't crispy. Otherwise it would have been perfect, like an Asian Buffalo wing.

Chilled Ramen: I enjoyed this - it's ramen noodles tossed with kimchi, egg, pickled cucumbers, seaweed and some kind of sweet chili sauce. Not too spicy but with a good kick, perfect on a cold day.

Service here is pretty solid - they're so quick at taking your orders, clearing out empty dishes, and making sure your drink is full. Heck we noticed the servers would stand on the sides watching tables (creepy but effective). I guess they understand that in a 90 minute limit, people want to keep the drinks and food going. The waiters helping us were very friendly and attentive, answering our questions and never rushing us (except when we were about to hit the 90 min limit, which is reasonable).

Honestly the only reason I docked a star is because I'm not sure if we got good value out of the brunch... at $37/pp + tax/tip you're looking at spending about $90 for 2 people. Assuming the amount we drank was worth 2 drinks each, it's about $8 each dish/drink. Portion wise it's expensive, but at least we got to try a variety and it was nice having that freedom.

Overall, we left happy and stuffed - heck I managed to skip lunch and dinner because of how much I ate. X_x .I was so full that if I tripped over I'd probably roll down one of the hills (figuratively speaking). It was a good experience and I might come back if I ever need to drink (and eat) myself into oblivion again.
author: Alyanna C.

description:
I'm a huge fanatic of mom and pop shops, especially when it comes to Chinese food. I love me some old fashion plates and freshly brewed tea. This was exactly what I was expecting when I stopped by Chubby Noodle, but unfortunately was not what I got )= 

Since it is located in the North Beach area, be sure to expect prices higher than usual and Chinese cuisine with a heavy Americanized emphasis. The atmosphere is targeted more towards a younger generation. But enough with this, lets get on with the food!

WE ORDERED:

The spicy garlic noodles - this was the spiciest garlic noodle I have ever had! If you're not into the spice, be sure to request for less spice!
Green beans - oh my lord. This was SUPERB. Crunchy and beautifully seasoned.
Fried Rice - fried rice anywhere is a win win. yaknowwhatimean

Overall, I found this place to be very interesting. I would have preferred some more light in the restaurant though. Even though we came during dinner time, it seemed like all the lights were off. Eh?! it was terribly dark! We could barely see what we were picking at with our chopsticks )= Because of this, I highly recommend coming during the daytime!  

I would recommend checking this place out solely for the food. It wasn't half bad! But for the atmosphere and price, I'll stick with my mom and pop shops.

p.s. this is the perfect place to stop by before a night out. their hip hop music will get you pumped hehe
author: Mary L.

description:
This place is a must! The ambiance is nice and trill, they play bangers, and the food is amazing. The food and service was nice and speedy! 

Definitely recommended the calamari and spicy garlic noodles! 

Toodles~
author: Shiena C.

description: Honestly usually a HUGE fan of chubby noodle but clearly only the marina location. The staff here is horrific. Let me clarify, the service staff sucks. The kitchen is amazing. The waiters are rude and act so bothered when you ask for a glass of water or if you even ask how their day is going. Not to mention, make sure when you make a reservation, you confirm the amount of people that will be there. Made a reservation for 8, 7 showed up, got charged for 8 anyway. Just a word of advice. If you want people to come back to this location I advise that you train your staff to be friendly and not dying of hangovers as they are serving your customers. And where are the ducks!? COME ON
author: Lauren A.

description: Cute spot, food is Okay, and friendly service. I've gone twice and think the food is a bit overpriced and the quality is good, but not great.
author: Michelle B.

description: I've only been to their brunch on Saturday and Sundays. It's a good deal. Who doesn't love an unlimited dim sum brunch? You get the option of choosing a or 5 things that you want per round but most of the time the items are revolving and waitresses will come to your table with something you might not want. It's ok to tell them no :) the drinks are amazing. They have seasonally flavored mimosas. The most recent one I've tried was watermelon and it was delicious. Aside from the food, the always have great 90s music playing very loud and it's An onverall fun ambiance.
author: Inci A.

description:
Okay, let me just start off by saying I have been to both locations (North beach and Marina) and this one is no where near as great as the one in the Marina. First, the staff has a stick so far up their ass I'm sure they have headaches from it trying to a puncture a hole through the top of their skulls. There were negative vibes from the moment we walked in and everyone was in a horrible mood. We felt like a total inconvenience to everyone and the staff's attitudes were absolutely terrible and it seemed almost forced when asked if we needed anything. Mimosas were basically water and the food was average at best. Oh and on top of that on our way back to the bathroom we could see the chef eating a sandwich while cooking the food! 

Do yourself a favor and do not I repeat DO NOT bother with this location. The other one may be small but holy shit the staff and ambiance is a complete 180 from this place. I actually had an amazing experience at the Marina location and would recommend everyone go to that one instead if you want amazing service, drinks and food.
author: Jacky Z.

description:
Right off the bat you notice the loud music! A little louder than I enjoy in a restaurant except they're playing all the current hip hop jams. 

We ordered the Garlic noodles, pork buns, and homemade kimchee. The garlic noodles was very mediocre. The waitress highly recommended the dish with the fried chicken option for protein. I would've opted for shrimp myself, but it sounded quite interesting. I was hoping for a crunchy element to add to the noodles. The fried chicken was a little on the dry side. They are white meat or possibly "tenders". Since the chicken is tossed into the noodles, they lost all the texture and became soggy. This dish was overly saucy which didn't help. 

The pork buns were also ok. Didn't have a punch and had only one note of flavor. I think they should also offer to add a pork bun since the dish comes with three and we were a party of two. I ordered the kimchee to help cleanse our palate between our other savory dishes but it wasn't quite pickled enough. Wasn't sour at all! 

Last note. Please do not order the watermelon mimosa. I hate to waste alcohol but it just...wasn't...good. Was the food bad? No. Was it great? Not really. Service took a little while to get the check. I felt a little ignored at the end but I understand their dinner crowd was starting to pick up.
author: Tracy N.

description:
Hopefully my review can help the management improve... or serve as a warning for people who are thinking of eating here.

In short: Bottomless brunch was nowhere near bottomless. Despicably bad service. Watered down drinks. No food brought to us. Cutting us short before our 90 minutes. Having the audacity to charge 20% tip (no where on the menu indicated a mandatory tip, correct me if I'm wrong. I came with a party of 5 for reference). 

Going to a bottomless drinks/food brunch establishment requires some preparation... you want to ensure you are hungry enough to try all the food items and make sure you are in the right state of mind to drink to your heart's content. 

I came on a Saturday with some friends expecting a good start to our weekend. The waitress sat us, took our drink orders, and we were promised a sampling of all their food items. Twenty minutes later and we have yet to get drinks and the only food they gave to us was their poorly pickled pickled vegetables. Our patience was overwhelmed by hunger and thirst, so we began flagging down whichever server seemed to be actually paying attention at the time for more food and drinks. 

On top of this slow service, the drinks were horribly watered down. The cantaloupe "mimosa" tasted like pulp + water, heavy on the water. The "sangria" tasted like rose + water, heavy on the water. I think there's a trend here... To add insult to injury, they began calling for last call just 60 minutes into our meal. The icing on the cake was when they ran out of ice and had someone go fill up garbage bags with ice somewhere and cart it in through the FRONT of the restaurant for all of us to see. 

When we finally got our check, we were flabbergasted how bold this waitress was to add a 20% tip. I was actually impressed with how she can look us in the face and expect us to tip her 20%. 

We tried to refund the tip amount- even going so far as writing a negative tip to negate the 20% and calling the restaurant, but they never refunded me the difference. Chubby Noodle, you owe me money, and I'm only asking for the tip amount (just the tip) and not the entire bill.
author: Sean S.

description: My buddy who recently visited SF told me I had to go here and get the noodles. Thank god for friends. We ordered Korean pork tacos and the spicy garlic noodles with fried chicken?! Yes, you must get the fried chicken. I will admit, if you don't like spicy food, you won't be able to eat this dish. My girlfriend couldn't finish hers because of the spice, but it was so good, I powered right through it. Probably one of the most unique and delicious noodle dishes I've ever had. Highly recommend getting your hands on this dish.
author: Nick D.

description:
My friend and I seat at the Bar and really it's the perfectspot. You get your food first and the drinks are never empty.
I love the brunch deal but the food was overly salty. 
Here are my thoughts:
The breakfast jook(favorite dish of the day! The sunny side egg was a amazing mix with th bacon and jook), mushroom bak choi (tasted more like salt then mushrooms), salt and pepper shrimp (lightly breaded with a good crunch at first bite.), Peking duck (overly cooked/dry), sezchuan green bean (super fresh green bean and lightly spiced but less salt would of been even better), pork wonton (meat was too hard(super packed but could be jucier) the skin you can tell it was dry and tough to bite, pass on this next time).

Food for thoughts! #whatsonyourtable
author: Lisa W.

description: I came here for brunch with a friend and we were seated along a small counter in the corner. However, we loved the area as it offered us a bit more privacy from the large groups in the main dining area. The brunch was very popular and lively and a lot of fun. We kept our favorite dishes coming, especially the green beans, the jook, and the dumplings. The noodles and fried rice were also very very good and our drinks were constantly filled. It was a really fun, delicious time! Definitely make sure to make a reservation first since they only do two seatings a day.
author: Margaret K.

description:
I visted this location with my friends when I visited my buddy in San Francisco. It was in this small area where they had a bunch of restaurants so I was expecting it to be good. I really liked the other location. 

We walked in and there was no host to be found. We looked around for a while trying to make eye contact with servers or people at the bar but no response. Finally we saw somebody over the corner table eating and she who pointed at a coner table for us to seat. As go to the table, I realize that the booths ar this location was too small and there was no way in hell I was gonna be able to sit uncomfortably where she pointed. We saw some tables with regular seats and sat there since no host was able to seat us.  

Our server took our order.Then a male host shows up and ask us if we can move to a booth because they have a large party coming in and our seats would sit their party. I told him that the seats were too small there was no way I would I would be uncomfortable to sit there. He looks at me with this look like "wtf".

After ordering, a good 15 mins later, our server comes up and says he didnt get a chance to turn in our order. All good we weren't in a rush he was actually really cool and hooked us up.

I personally was'nt didnt like the food that night. It might of been the experience leading up to the meal but wasn't impressed. The garlic noodle's noodle awas too over cooked and it feel apart. Everything else was alright. I feel the other location is way better.
author: Edwardson S.

description:
I've only been here for brunch, which is their all-you-can-eat, all-you-can-drink (of select options) offering. The first time I went, we didn't even know that it worked that way and were still happy. (I probably wouldn't have even tried this place if I had expected normal all-you-can-eat fare.)

The food is solid, and the staff/kitchen keep it coming. Still, I recommend ordering almost everything you have an interest in trying; servings per order aren't large. They're also ready with pitchers to refill people's drinks. When it's nice out, they keep windows open and allow in lots of fresh breeze.

The only reasons I would reconsider bringing someone are:

(1) It's pricey. The quality is good, but wow does it add up for a large table.
(2) There's usually really loud music playing. This doesn't bother me, but it may be too loud for some people.

If you do want to come for brunch near peak times, I recommend a reservation.
author: David S.

description: I just had my first Chubby Noodle experience! So glad I came in. Raine and Jenna took excellent care of me and it's clear they love what they do. I had the garlic noodles with pork and sat at the bar by myself with a beer and some sake. Such fun, nice, hospitable people! I'll be back for sure : ). Thank you!
author: Nicole C.

description: I've been at the Chubby Noodle in Marina and had a much better experience there. First off, the food is great, the garlic noodles are the best followed by the fried chicken. The papaya salad is amazing too, I must have eaten 2 bowls of it! However, I was very disappointed with the service of the kitchen staff. Granted it was during Sunday brunch where there is all-you-can-eat/drink but I felt like I was being skimmed on everything. We were not allowed to get certain items. I understand the salmon dish because that can be expensive, but Garlic Noodles?! Really? The drink are ridiculously expensive as well. $7 for a CAN of beer?! Maybe it was misrepresented but I was disappointed that I was still left hungry and sober at the end.
author: Ryan R.

description: Came in right before it closed and must say, it was mighty tasty! Host was great & accommodating. The server seemed like he wanted to get out on time, lol, all good tho, can't wait to try something else from here as well
author: Danielle N.

description:
Two stars because the menu LOOKS awesome and the interior was really cool buuuuut-

Was sat at a cute table by some chick in a drake shirt and we were so excited. Only to find out we were completely forgotten about. Literally sat there for about 15 minutes before we were like what the heck? Tried to get someone's attention but they were all huddled in the back or just standing behind the bar. At 20 minutes we called it and just walked out. Nobody noticed or said a thing. 

I WILL be back after my annoyance passes because I was so excited for this food. And I will update my review to hopefully better once I try the food. But I think it's important for people to know this happened. It's a tiny tiny tiny place. Things like this shouldn't be a thing.
author: Sierra B.

description: The food was good but that's as far as the good part ends.  Service was slow.  Food took very long to come out and did not come out at the same time.  When I asked how much longer my son's food will come out, the host said, rudely, I might add, The food comes out as its ready.  SMH.  As I said, food was good but not that good to deal with service like that.
author: Francisco C.

description:
Chubby Noodle is a very small restaurant, mostly set up in booth-style tables perfect for larger parties of 4-6 people. I came with a friend for weekday lunch, and it was so empty! We were seated with no problem and our waiter was very attentive throughout our meal.

+ SZECHUAN GREEN BEANS ($8): We needed greens to balance out our meal. These green beans were so savory, rich, crunchy, and popped once you bit into it so they did not feel like I was eating vegetables! These veggies are doused generously in a garlic, ginger, and oyster sauce blend perfect for munching on before your main courses arrive.
+ CHUBBY FRIED CHICKEN ($12): There are 6 generously sized fried chicken breasts paired with a great spicy mayo sauce for dipping. The chicken was perfectly fried and a great size for splitting! 
+ SPICY GARLIC NOODLES ($11): **These noodles are very spicy! I love spicy foods, but my friend was struggling through these noodles. They are egg noodles fried in a jalapeno and cilantro blend that disguises the spice because it is not noticeably red or green in color. I loved how perfectly soft the noodles were and the spice was a great pair with our green beans and fried chicken!

I had recently tried SO (related to San Tung) and got the same items and it just didn't compare. Chubby Noodle definitely wins on these 3 items!!
author: Sophie P.

description: I love the chubby noodle in the marina and frequently do brunch there on the weekends. The food at the North beach location is just as great. However, from my experience the service there is horrible. Staff was not coming back to fill drinks. Staff didn't bring out a dish I ordered and at the end of the bottomless time I notified them and they didn't do anything about it. Said we already ordered enough food for the bottomless. Pretty unacceptable in my opinion. Hopefully they can improve the service but for now I'll be sticking to the marina location.
author: Mehul S.

description:
This place is about as disappointing as Batman v. Superman was.

I came here in a party of three for brunch and quickly realized that it isn't really an all you can eat and drink establishment. The service was about as fast as my landlord is in fixing anything in my apartment (I'm talking about you, Chad). There was a large party that took up most of the restaurant and because of that, they seemed to neglect us. Each entree we ordered took 10-15 minutes to get to us, while the large party received a steady stream of food. Oh, and the drinks are also watered down. If you ever need to sober up, I suggest coming here for their mimosas, they're pretty much just water.
author: Mike K.

description: Love this place.  Came here for lunch and was seated by the window. The music was awesome although a bit on the loud side, it was kind of hard to hear my friend while we spoke. Anyways, service was fine. We ordered the garlic noodles with fried chicken within the noodles and spare ribs.  Everything, EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT. I am coming back and I'm going to try the prawns for sure!!!!
author: Jill P.

description:
Incredible. Made reservations for a Wednesday night - unnecessary - ended up coming in about an hour early and were seated right away. It's a small intimate space, love. Now onto the food..

The line up:
Tuna Poke
Szechuan Green Beans
Spicy Garlic Noodles
Chubby Fried Chicken

I would get everything again except the tuna, not horrible but not the best I've ever had. The green beans were actually my favorite part of the meal the flavor is just incredible, same goes for the fried chicken. Garlic noodles were good, usually I can handle anything super spicy but these are crazy hot, beware but once you get over that the flavor is good. Would definitely return.
author: Cara S.

description: Randomly came in for lunch and sat at the bar. The server was so nice and he helped me pick out a sake. I had a bowl of noodles and my book and it was such a relaxing time. I will come back here again just to enjoy my early afternoon. I want to thank the server who went to Japan and told me to go someday! Arigato
author: Aili P.

description:
Good food but not a lot :(

Forgot what day/time I went, but they had this happy hour thing where you could get noodle bowls for half off. The portions were really small though and I had to get two bowls. I was still pretty hungry after so idk if I'd come here often.

Noodles were really good though. I think I got the garlic noodle and some other spicy one. Idk if I'd risk trying the other bowls cause I don't know if their other noodles can beat the ones I got.

If they had bigger portions I'd definitely go back more often. I only know their happy hour portions though, so ya.
author: Adrian Y.

description: Ordered a high maintenance caviar order and everything was correct. Thank you for the attention to detail. Additionally, all items were delicious! Chubby noodle is the bees knees.
author: Erin W.

description: Super fun spot! I made reservations a few days prior (requires a credit card to hold) for dinner on a weekday. The place was pretty packed when we got there but were seated within a few minutes. I really liked the vibe of this restaurant, definitely more of a party spot - dimly lit and they had a pretty awesome r&b playlist playing in the background. We ordered the Korean pork tacos, BBQ fried rice w/ kimchee, fried chicken, and a liter of their classic chubby noodle sake.The dishes were all good, nothing amazing, but we had no complaints. I think I enjoyed the sake the most, it was very well balanced and refreshing. I'll have to come back sometime for the bottom brunch everyone keeps talking about though, adding to my lists of boozy brunch spots!
author: Angela K.

description:
This is a review for their ayce brunch only.

Maybe we came on a bad day, but the brunch experience for us was not as positive as others'.  We were greeted with a little attitude when we arrived early, and also at one point during our meal.  Hopefully it wasn't intentional.  All I have to say about that is: tone of voice is something to be mindful of.

I wouldn't recommend this brunch for big parties.  We were a big party; over 5 people. Their tables are small and seating is cramped.  When food starts coming in, there won't be enough space on your table.

Also, no rubber duckies in our mimosas.  I know that seems like such a petty thing to review, but when certain places are known for their little, charming details such as these rubber ducks, it catches your attention! And it's disappointing when you miss out on that.

Food though was very very good.
author: Janelle L.

description:
So I knew it was on the vwrge of being trendy so I expected it to be a young crowd and hip music. The seating was pretty meh I've sat in nicer park benches.
The food was pretty good the portions could be bigger for being "family style"
The menu covered lots of Asian faves thai, chinesse, thai and Japanese.
The price was good and the wait staff was young and cute. Def will be back hopefully before it becomes to cool for me.
author: nancy w.

description:
Small place .. Small plates.. Big Smile when you dine here..

It's an Asian Food Fusion ..with Great Bites..

Not to be missed.. their Pork Taco!!! For sure...

I'd Strongly recommend this Place for small bites .. good price and Good service!!!
author: Donovan L.

description: Service was great. The food was great. Drinks were great. What more do you want? The servers refilled my drink every time I was running low. The chicken chowmein was delicious.
author: Sergio C.

description:
If you're looking for flavor and spiciness, Chubby Noodle is worth your time. My friend and I arrived around 8 pm on a Saturday night and were seated immediately. It's a bit darker for mood lighting and there's "hip" music playing. 

We ordered the spicy garlic noodles, Korean pork tacos, kung pao wings, and pork ribs. The Korean pork tacos arrived first. There were two to an order. I liked the homemade tortilla and the flavor of the taco. Mine had a bit more fat than I would've liked but I easily spit that portion out. Next came the pork ribs, a must try recommended by my friend. They had a bit of a crispness to them and spicy and sweet. I can't eat the hot peppers but enjoyed the onions with the dish. Next came the spicy garlic noodles. These were extremely flavorful. My friend likes putting the pork rib sauce on the noodles but I liked the noodles as is. We decided at the last minute to add on the kung pao wings. The wings had a sauce similar to the pork ribs but with the spiciness turned up a notch. 

The whole meal was enjoyable, although a bit pricey. I probably would've chosen to not add the wings as it was a bit too much food for the two of us. All that being said, I definitely would return!
author: Olivia C.

description: A delightful meal.  Service was prompt.  Family of 6 (4 kids) finished every plate that was served.  The noodles were amazing and had a good amount of spice that the kids could handle.  Highly recommend!  This was a great find for us while on vacation.
author: P R.

description: They served the garlic noodles with pan charcoal leftovers in them and taste of the noodles were too bland.
author: Madhur A.

description: Went on a Friday evening but the wait didn't end up being that long. Small and loud inside but very quick service. I got my noodles in a few minutes after putting in my order. And they were soooo good! I love spicy foods and the garlic noodles were a perfect amount of spicy. I think the waitress was trying to hurry us up and take our plates so they could get the table ready for another group but it didn't bother us.
author: Jo S.

description: One of my new favorite places for noodles. We like to go early and wait for the place to open. Garlic noodles are a must-try. Ramen is also surprisingly good. Their green beans are amazing. The sake flight is also fun. We bring our two toddlers here and they love it- the food the music, the lively ambience. Considering it's such a cozy and trendy little spot, they are very kid-friendly and we always get great service. Highly recommend.
author: Aggie L.

description:
Had food from here twice. Once on uber eats which was barely ok. 

The second was for the weekend brunch. If you compared the food panda express tastes way better, and panda express is awful. This place is meant for people who aren't really trying to eat, but more so for the people just trying to drink in the morning.
author: Sam R.

description: I was recommended to try this place several times by a friend. Kept hyping up how amazing it was so I wanted to try it out. When we were seated, I asked our server what we were supposed to do and she just told me to pick what ever I wanted off the menu and they will bring it out. She was not the friendliest and I felt like we were "bothering her". My husband and I kept seeing all these yummy dishes coming for other tables but had no idea what they were. Asked what was recomended and she pointed to one or two things. So we ordered a few things... They were ok. I really wanted to love this place. But the service and the food was just ok to... especially for the price... $46 per person for AYCE brunch. When I told my friend how my experience was, he said when he went (to the other location, btw) his server was very friendly and helpful. Suggested the menu as a tasting session and brought out everything for them to try in the order that the server thought would best compliment the last dish. Hmmm... that was not our experience. I wasn't planning on going back after our first experience, but I might be willing to try it again... at the other location.
author: A M.

description: Service sucks. Hostess is the worst. Went to seat us and then gave out spot to her friends. We
author: Lindsay S.

description: North Beach location only. Terribly rude hostess. Ashame because we go to the Marina location all the time and that's a 5-star all day.
author: John I.

description:
Easily one of my favorite brunches in the city-- many restaurants have either unlimited food or unlimited drinks, but here you can find the best of both worlds. Even though the food AYCE, it's still high quality (they do take their time bringing it out though). Strongly recommend the chicken, green beans, salt and pepper shrimp, jook, ramen, and chow mein, in that order. I also really wanted to try the Peking duck buns but unfortunately they ran out, so make sure you order those early.

The drinks were a bit unconventional. Mimosas are mixed with seasonal fruit juice and the sangria was a light pink color-- not sure what type of wine it contained. They weren't the best drinks I've had, but hey at least it's unlimited!
author: Amy C.

description: I love chubby noodle for brunch especially because it's all you can eat and bottomless brunch drinks! You definitely have to book in advance or show up early. I love the ambiance and the amazing rap music they blast! Grey spot for brunch with friends when you are l long to relax and have s good time! Green beans recommended :)
author: Ellie J.

description:
Chubby Noodle is such a fun spot in North Beach! It's the perfect spot to grab dinner before a night out or for brunch. Their bottomless drinks + unlimited food for 90 minutes brunch is super fun. They keep the glasses filled and the orders coming. Super helpful that they take reservations too. And of course the best part...the music they play (insert fire emoji). Official Chubby North is the Spotify playlist name, you're welcome.

The place is poppin at dinner too. The food isn't bad either. I'd recommend the garlic noodles and the fried shrimp. This is definitely the spot to have a good time with a group of friends.
author: Renu A.

description:
First of all, great food! Try the fried chicken and garlic noodles. Those are my favorites. Also, the music is awesome if you're into rap/hip-hop (they have a Spotify playlist that I LOVE).

Some downfalls:
-The music is super loud. It's hard to hear other people sometimes. If you're going out to eat with a group of friends, I'd recommend it, but if you're going on a date, you should probably go somewhere else.
-I didn't like that they brought the food out separately instead of all at once. That makes it awkward for the table because you really shouldn't eat until everyone has their food.
author: Remy B.

description: Go here and get the fried chicken, the garlic noodles, the green beans, and the house sake :)
author: Steph A.

description:
Excellent: Kale salad- I didn't expect to like this the most, but it was very fresh, crisp and flavorful. 

Good: BBQ fried rice- this was pretty tasty. Very heavy on scallions if you're into that. I just didn't find it to be a good value though. 

Pass: (1) crispy cauliflower- they weren't crispy at all and you could taste whatever powder they were coated in. There was a puddle of oil, despite not being crispy. I love cauliflower in all forms so I was really disappointed this was so off the mark. (2) Kobe beef chow mein- sauce was too thick and sweet. No thank you. 

I don't think I'll be back given all the good food options in the area.
author: Mai L.

description:
Came here for brunch, would recommend making a reservation ahead of time because it will be packed, and since everyone is doing all you can eat/drink, waiting would be a waste of time. 

Drinks are yummy, and the selection of food is great. I think it's a great deal for the price. 

They had good music playing and the staff was friendly and attentive. Come with a group of friends!
author: RachEl L.

description:
Ohhhhh goodness.. where do I even start with this place. After all the busy reservation and walk-in attempts, finally got to try this place out on a Sunday. (Definitely make your reservation AHEAD of time, typically no luck with walk-ins or prepare for over an hour wait and by that time, they'll be closed tyvm) Sounds like a bright idea being able to have AYCE dim sum for brunch right...... except there are a few catches. DON'T FALL FOR THE HYPE.

1. Um I came here for the rubber duckies in my drink, how come they were missing on my first drink? 
2. It's $45 a pop now
3. Menu claimed 16 dim sum items when I manually counted only 15 (where's the secret menu?)
4. Allotted time to eat: 90 mins (nothing more)
5. No double fisting -- well maybe it'll be helpful if you stop refilling the same drink so I can try the other 3 options (if they refilled it already and you wanted to try something else, they'll take that drink away before giving you the other options)
6. They order everything for you by their order of choice. I'm sure if you want to replace anything else to start off with first you can but better beat them to it.
7. "We reserve the right to slow your roll" -- first off maybe if y'all stop helping us make our orders first then we might get a chance to order something we actually want to eat. Secondly, maybe if you stop ordering 2-3 of the same dish that we don't care about (they quoted "the xo rice noodle doesn't seem like a hit huh? Yeah I never tried it, I can't eat it."), it would not look like we have that much food on the table to make our next order cause those foods were untouched and you're capping us out b/c you see that we're still not done. 
8. Never felt so rush within a 90 min period, feels like I'm eating in a food competition and it's just constantly go go go b/c we get constant reminders of how many minutes we have left, can't even enjoy the food.
9. Sorry to disappoint but they're all NOT (actually) dim sums... smh facepalm /)_-

Alright I swear I can go on forever. Now let's move onto the food and drinks shall we? 

Drinks: 
- Cold tea (alcoholic): S-K-I-P. Taste disgustingggg. 
- The "Hoang" mimosa: aka pineapple mimosa as they like to introduce there. My first cup, too much champagne, too little pineapple. Second, too much pineapple juice too little champagne. Let's get a consistency here. 
- Jose rose sangria: JUST STICK WITH THIS ONE. Best tasting one yet. Then again I won't be surprise if these were the Costco's Kirkland's sangrias because they taste exactly the same to me. 
- Sapporo: didn't even try this one. Already know how Sapporo taste like. For you non-wine peeps out there, beer might be for you. 

Food:
I'm not even gonna talk about them individually. One word: SODIUM. Two words: TOO SALTY. Three words: STOP WITH GINGER. Ok letssssss do a quick rundown. With the least hope and shocking tasting the best goes to the cucumber salad sadly (because it's the only sweet vinegary thing). Everything were overly flavored in the wrong way and c'mon stop with the gingery spin (wontons, wings). Green beans and eggplants are safe. Breakfast jook was horrible... first time having sunny side up in my jook. The kimchi stew with ramen? Let me cook you half a bag of shin ramyun with eggs and kimchi. And please don't order us 3 plates of xo rice noodles when they're those over cooked rice papers without xo sauce taste. The tacos.... it's like the Peking duck steam buns replaced by tortilla. Salt and pepper shrimp... salty so use the dipping sauce to cover it up. Fried rice.... feels like it was cooked with a bag of mixed greens and got stir fried. The dan dan mein... it's a lot of soy or oyster sauce y'all used. Have you noticed these are all not dim sums yet? 

Tbh you're literally a block or 2 away from Chinatown from this place, just go get yourself some more authentic Chinese food for you bucks. Lastly there's only 1 restroom in the back of the kitchen so prepared to wait in a fat line for that. Also, no joke about that 90 min mark, they don't care if you paid already and you're just sitting there waiting for your friend to finish with the restroom, they're gonna boot you to wait outside.
author: Aly C.

description: This place is MY LIFE. Pork tacos + garlic noodles topped with fried chicken. You're welcome.
author: H H.

description:
Really tasty tonkatsu broth for the ramen + small portions + really high prices = 3 stars. 

The food is definitely on point here but if you come in with a big appetite you'll leave with both your stomach and wallet feeling a bit empty.
author: Sam L.

description:
Duck, duck, duck... no goose?

Okay, maybe not, but Chubby Noodle serves drinks with a rubber ducky which I thought was super cute. Last Saturday, June 25th, a group of my girlfriends decided to get together for a ladies brunch. We made a reservation beforehand for a party of 8 at 12:15pm. They were running behind, so we didn't get seated for about 20 minutes.

The concept is to Mix & Match from a choice of 14 dim sum items & 3 brunch drinks for 90 minutes. Price is $37 per person, no to go and no double fisting. We all stuck to the THE "HOANG" MIMOSA: sparkling wine and seasonal fruit, which was watermelon, but you can also choose from their JOSÉ ROSÉ SANGRIA: ca rosé, elderflower, cranberry and apple juice or SAPPORO: japan. They did end up giving us a shot of sake each due to the long wait, which was super sweet.

soup & porridge
*SZECHUAN SHRIMP & PORK SOUP: char sui pork, shrimp, baby spinach, bean sprouts, chilis
*BREAKFAST JOOK: smoked bacon, egg, chili oil, charred garlic and scallions

I loved the porridge! And it was so pretty! Creamy and full of flavor. The soup broth was flavorful and light, but out of the two dishes, I enjoyed the jook a lot more.

noodles & rice
*CHILLED RAMEN: korean chili dressing, fried egg, kimchi and pickles
*CHUBBY CHICKEN CHOW MEIN: egg noodles and vegetables
*SHRIMP FRIED RICE: shrimp, egg, scallion

Of course you need carbs when doing bottomless mimosas! The chow mein and rice were fried nicely. I thought the noodles were more flavorful than the rice. The chilled ramen was pretty good considering I'm not a huge fan of cold noodles. Reminded me a little of the cold korean noodle dish without the vinegar element.

dumplings
*PORK WONTONS: ginger, cilantro and soy
*SHANGHAI DUMPLINGS: chinese bbq chicken, fresh fun doe and scallions
*STEAMED PORK BUNS: hoisin, napa cabbage, thai chilis, shittake mushrooms

The only thing I really enjoyed from this section was the pork wontons. They were moist and juicy. The shanghai dumplings didn't end up being the soup dumplings I thought they would be. They were really big and the skin was super thick. And no soup! The pork bun filling was a little dry, so I just took a bite of the insides.

dim sum
*PEKING DUCK STEAM BUN - limited availability (serves 4): peking duck, pickles, hoisin sauce and steam bun
*SALT & PEPPER SHRIMP: shrimp, garlic, chili and cilantro
*KUNG PAO WINGS: arbol chili, garlic and ginger 

You must the the peking duck buns! It's not the traditional peking duck as the skin wasn't separated from the duck, but I loved the flavors. An order only comes with three buns, so I'm not sure why the description says it serves four. Get three orders if you are a party of 8. The rest of the items were just okay. The wings were a little too sweet for me and the shrimp wasn't as crispy as I normally like.

extra
*ORANGE SALAD: orange vinaigrette, carrots, spring mix, walnuts 
*GARLIC GREEN BEANS: wok tossed garlic, ginger, oyster sauce 
*BOK CHOY & MUSHROOMS: wok tossed, bok choy, garlic

We didn't get the orange salad, but we tried the rest of the dishes. I love green beans and these still retained a nice crunch. The bok choy and mushrooms were average. I wish they were a little more garlicky. I found them a little bland.

Super fun place for brunch. You can definitely drink and eat the afternoon away. Though I did have a wicked headache later on in the day. Maybe from the sparking wine? Regardless, I had a great time! I'd love to come back and try their sangria next time. I can never say no to a bottomless brunch!
author: Elena N.

description: I love Ramen... this place had the blandest Ramen I've ever had!... almost no flavor... on top of that the egg in the ramen was cold like it just came from the fridge. It was late so maybe they weren't on their game
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Trap music and 90's hip hop is blasting, which is hilarious and awesome.

I came with a group of five for brunch at noon. We had a reservation, and based on how busy they were I was recommend that you do the same. Bottomless mimosas, sangria and Sapporo beer were flowing (with cute rubber duckies) and the food was delicious. 

For 90 minutes, it's all you can eat! Our server recommended that we let him bring out plates at his discretion, which we did at first, but later regretted. The best thing to do is honestly just to order a bunch of items at once (90 precious minutes, people) and keep asking for more. Our sever insisted that dinner is even better than brunch at the Chubby Noodle, but I find that hard to believe...it was all just so phenomenal tasting and just hit the spot. A+ experience, A+ food.

Highly recommend: all of it.
Favorites: green beans, pork dumplings, duck buns.
author: Paige A.

description:
Love getting Danica as our waitress. She makes the Chubby experience great.

Go for brunch on Sunday and request her
author: Alex H.

description: Tried this place out for dinner after work and not knowing what to expect. It was a pretty good fusion place. Had the right mix of flavors and variety. Wasn't too crowded (possibly because we got there so late), so we got seated right away. It has a great vibe, environment, and food quality. Definitely worth returning.
author: Kevin W.

description:
By far my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco. You can't go wrong with the Korean Pork Tacos, Spicy Garlic Noodle, or the Green Beans. Recently tried the Papaya salad and it was delicious as well. 
The service has always been great when visiting. They even have their own Spotify playlist you can listen to!
author: Katrina B.

description:
Chubby Noodle on the weekends is an EXPERIENCE.

It's $37/pp for 1.5 hours of all-you-can-stuff-your-face (AYCE & AYCD) brunch bliss. If you choose to make a reservation, the clock starts running at the time of your reservation, not when you arrive, so get there early!

Atmosphere is "trendy" or "poppin,'" complete with hip hop music blasting and tables taking shots of vodka. It was around 1pm when I spotted this. Nice.

Their menu is relatively short and simple, and food comes out pretty quickly. The servers we had were rushed, but attentive. They were really great at making sure our glasses were full and keeping us updated on how much time we had left. 

Things my group of 4 would (and did) order twice: 
++ Watermelon Mimosa: I much preferred this light drink over the sangria on the menu! 
++ Chilled Ramen: cool, refreshing, and tasty ramen noodles with a fried egg, kimchi, and pickled cucumbers
++ Pork Wontons: not particularly authentic, but really flavorful!
++ Garlic Green Beans: super tasty and borderline addictive. We polished our first and second plate off with relative ease. 

I wouldn't bother with: 
-- Shanghai Dumplings: we ordered these thinking they'd be like xiao long bao, but the skin was dense and thick. The filling was extremely dry - nothing like the soup dumplings I expected!

Overall, definitely a unique experience that I would not mind paying for again, but I probably would wait for a special occasion to come back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
A bit underwhelming, overpriced and not worth the hype asian fusion.  

Ordered the pork tacos which were a too saucy for my liking.  11 bucks for that is pretty much a rip off to the max.  I get that it's pricey here in SF but come on...you can go right next door to the house and get any entree that tastes better for the price.  I hate to rip on a place based on 1 item but my coworkers who ordered the pad thai didn't seem impressed either.

The decor and vibe makes me really want to like this place so I'll give it another go one day and hope it changes my mind
author: Vince L.

description:
Came here with 3 of my girlfriends for their bottomless dimsum brunch! Definitely make reservations beforehand because this place definitely fills up. Luckily we snagged seats at the bar (a blessing in disguise because we got our drinks filled super fast ;D)

For $37 per person, you and your friends can stuff your faces with a mix of 13 different dishes and 3 different alcoholic drinks! The highlights of my meal were:
- Salt & pepper shrimp: One of my faves! The shrimp are crunchy and I loved the sauce that came with it
- Chilled ramen: I didn't expect to like this but it was really good! This had a korean sauce, kimchi, and a fried egg and was a little spicy.
- Kung pao wings: Sweet and saucy wings! Not the greatest wings i've had, but definitely hit the spot. Wish they were crunchier too.
- Chubby chicken chow mein: Underrated! Seems like a simple dish but was yummy.
- Steamed pork buns: The mix of pork, mushrooms, cabbage and hoisin was heavenly with the pillowy bun! Although the meat/mushroom/cabbage ratios were very inconsistent. 
- Szechuan green beans: The word "szechuan" makes this dish sound spicy but it wasn't! 
- "Nguyen" win mimosa: So easy to drink!
- Jose rose sangria: Wish we started on this sooner! The sangria was sweeter than the mimosa. I think I liked the sangria more.

& the mediocre stuff:
- Pork wontons: These were decent but not my fave. There were these peppers in the sauce and I ate one... HOOLLYY, it set my mouth on fire!!! Hahaha be careful!
- Shrimp fried rice: Pretty bland
- Hot & sour soup: I'm not a fan of hot and sour soup so I didn't like it that much. Friends liked it though!

By no means is this authentic or traditional dimsum (you won't find any siu mai or ha gao here), but what stood out to me was the affordable price point, the great music and the awesome customer service! Where else can you get all you can eat AND drink for under $40? (If you know a place, let me know haha) The bartender Travis as well as all the other staff were really friendly and attentive during service. The playlist was a mix of old and new songs and my friends and I really enjoyed it (and somewhat felt like we were at the club, LOL)!
author: Tara A.

description:
Ordered through DoorDash and apparently the driver told us they were extremely late with getting the food ready, so I'm not sure if service is better in person.

To sum up Chubby Noodle, overpriced Chinese mediocre food. The chicken wings ordered were soggy and tasted like ketchup, spicy garlic noodles were extremely heavy compared to other garlic noodles I've tried, and no effort went into making the food presentable. I would recommend spending your money elsewhere!
author: Bik H.

description:
Decent brunch place, perfect for when you wake up starving and want to eat everything. Not everything on the menu was a hit for me, but there were enough tasty things for me to want to go back some time.

It's an all you can eat/drink place - which was a surprise to me when I showed up because I just yelped "ramen" and didn't read any of the reviews because I was hungry.

We went here on a Sunday morning (around 11am) with no reservation. All the tables in restaurant were reserved by the time we walked in but there were seats at the bar so we took those. It was $37 for the all you can eat menu (which is the only thing they offer there). The mimosa flavor of the day was honeydew and you can get it without alcohol - which was really good since I don't drink. The drinks had little rubber ducks floating in them which was adorable (http://bit.ly/211aflh)

We had:
Chilled Ramen (http://bit.ly/1WB28NW)
One of my favorites from the meal. It's a dry chilled ramen with kimchi, vegetables, and a runny egg. Didn't completely satisfy my ramen craving since it's not your typical ramen but still delicious nonetheless.

Pork Wontons (http://bit.ly/1Y9GiAx)
Really good. There were random spicy bits in it. We ordered 2 of these.

Breakfast Jook (http://bit.ly/1sZapyv)
A decent breakfast jook. One of the better things in the menu though it doesn't stand out to me when compared with jook I've had at other places.

Shrimp Fried Rice (http://bit.ly/1Urkr1r)
Average fried rice. There are better things to eat on the menu especially since rice fills you up pretty fast.

Steamed Pork Buns (http://bit.ly/1Pdivsh)
These came in steam buns like the ones on peking duck. The filling was a bit salty for me but overall it's a decent dish.

Shanghai Dumplings
These were dry and disappointing. I believe they had pork filling. I wouldn't order this again.

Peking Duck Steam Buns (http://bit.ly/1XuFc3x)
Decent duck, a bit dry. It comes with everything you would expect. I definitely recommend ordering these.

Bok Choy and Mushrooms (http://bit.ly/1tavDtQ)
Pretty good vegetables.
author: Lily L.

description:
Tried this place for the first time last week and I'm already plotting to come back as soon as possible. If you like asian fusion and cute cocktails, then you will love this place. The venue is a bit small so I can imagine it gets fairly crowded during weekends, but I came on a Wednesday night and was seated right away. 

We ordered some of the popular items as recommended by the waiter; spicy garlic noodles, szechuan green beans, and the korean pork tacos. The garlic noodles were actually pretty spicy and my boyfriend could barely handle it - if you don't like spicy food, then maybe this isn't for you. I thought they were amazing, especially with the fried chicken added in. The Korean pork tacos were delicious, but it's a small plate - only two tacos, so if you're sharing with a group you may need to order more. Every bite was flavorful and the pork was juicy, not dry. 

The cocktail list was unique with quirky names and sake based concoctions. I tried the Chubby Kitten - watermelon and nigori (which I just found out is a type of sake). There's also a few drinks that come in pitchers which is perfect for large groups.

The booth-style seating was comfortable and the service was fast. I loved the 90's/2000's rap playlist they had on rotation, and the overall feel of the place was chill. I will definitely be coming back here to try the kobe beef chow mein and salt & pepper shrimp -- and maybe even the bottomless dim sum if I'm in the area on the weekend.
author: Sara S.

description: Went to the North Beach location. I was so disappointed. Their menu is extremely limited (or was when we were there), and this place is not vegetarian friendly. It was dirty (you have to walk through the kitchen to get into the bathroom, and I was grossed out). I've heard the other location is good, so maybe I'll give that a try one day....
author: Rob M.

description: The BEST Asian inspired fried chicken and sautéed green beans I've ever had in my entire life. I dream about this place. We ate here twice in our same visit to SF. Fun atmosphere, good drinks and music. Chubby noodle is a must .
author: Shaina S.

description: This is my 2nd time at Chubby Noodle. First one was at the Marina location 2 years ago and now this other location. Both times I can say the food was so darn good and the hip hop music just creates a fun atmosphere. Ready to go back on my next trip!
author: Jamie R.

description:
Honestly don't know if I just came on an off day...none of the food was that good to me! :( I honestly don't think it's worth it. My friends and I tried pretty much all of the dishes and only one of them I liked enough to desire eating more than one bite. The only dish that I wanted more than one portion of was the duck buns. I'm not sure if it's just because I don't like the 'fusion' asian style they did here or if the food is just not that good :/ 

It costs ~$40 for unlimited food and drink. Their drinks are okay, from what I remember the sangria tastes better than their mimosa. They have cute little rubber ducks in their drinks too. They play pretty loud music and they keep their window wide open, so it's pretty nice on warm days. 

Overall I think it's fine to drop by to enjoy the atmosphere, but not worth going here if you want to enjoy good food.
author: Theresa L.

description:
Come here for brunch over lunch/dinner. Reviewed the other location for dinner and was a fan as well, but the AYCE brunch was way more fun and tasty! 

Food - Favorites were the peking duck with steamed buns, kung pao wings and salt and pepper shrimp. The dishes are bold and flavorful and it's fun to try a bit of everything! Only item we didn't try was the chilled ramen, but by then we were way stuffed to finish anything new. It's only "dim sum" in the sense that the dishes are shared and smaller portions (though the portions add up!) and it's a totally westernized Asian fusion experience.

Drinks - Even though I came in knowing drinks were included in the $37, it coincidentally fell during a "dry weekend," so I didn't intend to partake. By stroke of fate (or dumb luck) I passed on the mimosa/sangria and ordered the cold tea, thinking it was literally some form of tea with ice. Turns out the cold tea didn't have wine, but it was a mixed drink with sake. Needless to say the floodgates opened shortly after. 

Service - Since it was our first time and we wanted to try everything, our server just started bringing us dishes and they kept on coming. We tried everything they had that day and were constantly asked if we wanted seconds on anything. The refills kept coming too! Definition of bottomless. They don't try to slow you at all here. You're capped at 90 minutes, but that's more than enough time to get your fill of food and drink! 

Ambiance - There was literally a table next to us asking the server for club recommendations on their way out. Keep in mind this is 1pm on a Sunday. LOL. In classic Chubby Noodle style it's loud and poppin' at all hours of the day.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Chubby Noodle North Beach was our first restaurant experience in San Francisco (June 6, 2017) and it was absolutely fabulous! Drinks: I had Tough Titty Said The Kitty... and my husband had the Dino-bite Lemonade. Two thumbs up on these. The bartender also surprised us with a couple shots of house saki upon learning this was our first time in SF (awesome, right?) Dinner: We shared the Szechuan Green Beans, the Curry Lemongrass Vermicelli, and the Spicy Garlic Noodles. Everything was spectacular.  Service was fast and everyone there was very friendly.  I highly recommend this place!  

Sincerely, Detroit-foodies
author: The B.

description:
My go-to cheap and cheerful around the corner from me dinner place! Waits can be bad on weekend dinners and so Im usually here during the week...
Love this place, menu is solid, food is good, service is friendly, atmosphere is fun! Perfect for a large group to hang out or just an easy chill dinner at the bar!
author: E B.

description:
This place was Terrific!
My husband & I ordered the Ribs, Garlic Noodles & a Cucumber Salad. 

Service was quick.
Staff was very friendly.

Pro:
Great Menu
Fair Prices

Con:
Small place, gets crowded easily.

I would definitely go again and again.
author: Isaak M.

description: I would definitely say not your typical brunch spot, which for me is a good thing. I do love me some french toast and and eggs benedict but chubby noodle definitely is a nice change from that. Upon entering, hip-hop music is playing, my type of place. The food is also a steer away from the usual brunch fair. Chicken wings, cold ramen, pork buns, and more could be ordered off the set brunch menu, all you can eat. Also, the drinks were quite different than just your regular bottomless mimosa. There were 3 different drinks to choose from, all you can drink. The price was a little more than I would pay for a brunch, but with bottomless food and drink, I couldn't really complain. The only thing was that there was a time limit of how long you could stay, I want to say it was two hours max. It was plenty time for me and my group but I always feel rushed when there's a time limit. Would try again.
author: Jessica F.

description:
The food here is really good but since its 
"bottomless" it takes 10 years to get your food. I came here with a party of 7 and they brought out one small dish at a time so we each had one bite and would have to wait for the next dish. Eventually when food started to come out a little faster we were full from the waiting so long and drowning ourselves in mimosas. The waitress came and asked for last call and we ordered 3 dishes (2 of each) but they only brought out 1 of each. This place isn't really bottomless food just bottomless mimosas. With tip it was about $52 each, worth it? Not really
author: Prabisha T.

description:
I like the concept of bottomless mimosas + all you can eat brunch but the service and drinks weren't great. 

Drinks -only mimosas or something they call sangria but looked nothing like it; they also ran out of the sangria by the end of our allotted brunch time and we had reminded them we wanted it multiple times

Food - very good;  I liked the chow mein, salt and pepper shrimp,  green beans and wings

Atmosphere -fun for groups with fun loud music, party vibes
author: Daniela J.

description: This place is what you would expect from white people running an Asian restaurant. We tired a little bit of everything since either was all you can eat brunch, food was okay and the drinks weren't that great.. The food tasted just like what you would get at panda express. Or just maybe don't come here when their doing brunch hour.
author: Diane Kim L.

description: Good food and hot music. It's a fun place but not great for conversations because the music is so painfully loud and they refuse to turn it down. Still, the poke is killer.
author: Julia L.

description:
MEHHHHH is how I would sum up the experience. The lauded spicy garlic noodles weren't balanced whatsoever w/ the spice removing any semblance of garlic from the dish. The pork ribs were alright, passable. The fried rice was really the highlight of the meal and had a great texture; there were pieces of char siu spread throughout. We also had the steamed pork buns which were exceptionally mediocre - mildly flavorful bbq pork mixed w/ some mushroom. All in all, come here to rock out to the loud music and not necessarily for the food.

I also wanted to add that the portion of the Salt and Pepper Shrimp was laughable. We got what appeared to be 8 or so miniature shrimp. #meh^9
author: Alex S.

description: This was the worst service I've ever experienced. The hostess was hostile in terms that she wouldn't feed my friend and I unless we had a third party. We felt very disrespected as this didn't make sense how they could seat three but not make any accommodations for only two people.
author: Marc G.

description:
The food was good, but felt a little lacking in flavor - except for the Korean Pork Tacos. I would come again JUST for that dish. Highly recommend trying the tacos if you come here!  

KOREAN PORK TACOS - 5/5 

CHUBBY FRIED CHICKEN - 4/5 
Really good and definitely worth a try! 

SPICY GARLIC NOODLE - 3.5 or 4/5 
Tasty dish but nothing special. Very shareable and generous portion though. 

SZECHUAN GREEN BEANS - 3/5 
It was a decent dish, but thought something was missing. I wouldn't really consider it "Szechuan," but it had good flavor.
author: Poy W.

description:
Really spectacular food. I had the tacos, which were amazing, particularly their home made tortillas. Possibly the best tortillas I've ever had. 

This isn't to discount the rest of the meal at all, which was also great. Friends had the ribs and garlic noodles, which were also incredible. I hope to return soon.
author: William R.

description: They didn't have the brunch special when I went, but I heard they have great mimosas. Other than that, was a quite delicious meal (though a bit on the pricier side for its proximity to Chinatown). Got the garlic spicy noodles and the ribs, was a good combo (and enough for two people.)
author: Cheechee L.

description:
Chubby noodle is such a small place but yet they were still able to accommodate my large party of 9. Called in to make a reservation and when they were unsure, they gave a call back later in the day to give confirmation. Staff is super friendly and understanding.

Portion is a little small in my opinion. Of all the stuff my party ordered, I'll give the best and worst. 

Best: Gotta get the Chubby Fried Chicken $11. Delicious and the sauce is amazingg. 
Worst: The Spicy Garlic Noodles $10 were heavily peppered, making it really spicy and not very tasty.

Since we were celebrating a birthday, they were super nice by giving us all a shot of their special Chubby Noodle sake, on the house. It was really smooth. Should definitely come give this place a try.
author: Benita M.

description: Spicy garlic noodles a little too soft for me but they are great. Salt and pepper shrimp a little bit too salty; and I love salt. Korean tacos, the meat was too dry.
author: Pawel W.

description:
tldr; too expensive for the low quality, but if you eat a TON then it makes sense to come here

So... mixed thoughts. Chubby Noodle is a great place for group brunch, especially if you're with a group of hungry people who can eat and drink a ton. In which case, it makes sense. But if you're with a group of people who just want to eat a normal amount of food, I don't think it makes sense to make a ton of money for mediocre food. 

I came here with a group of about 7. Basic concept for brunch is you have a set amount of time (1.5 hours) to eat. Everything on the menu is fair game for both food and drinks. The food is different forms of Asian fusion -- kimchi ramen bowl, lo mein, duck with steamed buns, pork buns, garlic green beans, jook, wontons, fried shrimp, wings, etc. It's on the lower quality side, but it's filling and tastes pretty solid. The servers are pros here and are great about refilling food and making the eating turnover pretty fast.

So why 3 stars? Well, ultimately, this place just doesn't make sense in my opinion for most people. It was about $60 for brunch. Like what...? I have no idea how a $37/brunch as advertised on the menu somehow ended up being $60 when we didn't order anything extra or special. Given that price, I can't in good conscience recommend this as a good brunch place unless you eat like a tank. With $60, I can get less food, but actually high quality delicious food and a drink at some other more upscale brunch places. 

Other minor quip -- I HATE places that get snooty about not seating you until your party arrives. I came on a rainy day and our reservation was for 10:15am. The restaurant was empty and our table was set up, and the waiter asked me to stand in the rain. Like come on... I'm not asking for food or water or anything. I'm literally asking to not stand in the rain. Given that our table is ready, I'm not sure why if one person in our party is late we need to all huddle in the rain.
author: Jasmine X.

description: This was a home run! We had the brunch, and it was amazing.SOOO much food and everything was great! Unlimited drinks and food for 90 minutes. Make your reservation early though and come hungry!
author: Donna M.

description:
This place is a hit or miss:

Yes to:

Garlic noodles- flavorful and a hint of spicy, really good 
Pork Buns- served piping hot, pork is flavorful

Skip:
Tonkotsu Ramen- not very flavorful and pricey at $14 for very little noodles 
Chubby Fried Chicken- essentially  dry chicken tenders with mayo dip

I will be back to try the all you can eat/drink brunch though to stuff my face full of duck buns, they look promising, but they aren't offered on their daily menu.
author: Linda H.

description:
Our first experience when walking in this past Saturday evening looking for a table was being greeted by Jordan, the energetic GM, who politely apologized that the wait was going to be roughly 30 minutes. He took my brother's cell# down and told us he'd call when our table was ready. However, after about 10 minutes, he called and notified us that they were ready for us. Unfortunately, we were busy scarfing down a slice of pizza so we asked him to let the party behind us go first. When we returned(10 mins later) and as we were standing by the door, he brought over complimentary sake shots and again sincerely thanked us for waiting. 

When we were sat shortly after downing our shot, he showed us to our table and said he'd bring by yet another shot. We ordered some small dishes to share, the Spicy Garlic Noodles weren't too salty and were a bit on the spicy side(which suited me well). The Peking Duck Steam Buns were warm, fresh and juicy. The Korean Pork Tacos were succulent and also a bit on the spicy side. The small dishes are complemented well especially if you're indulging in some sake and/or beer. During our meal, we were checked in on 3 times. I can't say enough about the service here. It was literally almost overwhelming.

Don't come here expecting a quiet date but come here knowing that you will be taken care of, and that you should expect to enjoy some good food and drinks, and unwind from your hectic life in a slick and fun atmosphere.
author: Dennis W.

description:
I will say that their food was really good BUT...

They took our reservation for 2pm and guaranteed us a 90-minute bottomless brunch period but stopped serving us at 3pm. Not only that, they did not bring all the food we ordered and when we asked for our food, they told us it was after last call and we weren't allowed to order anymore. This was food we ordered at 2pm. And when we ordered our last round of drinks, they took away some people's glasses and only served last rounds to people whose glasses they didn't take away and we couldn't order drinks for those in our party that didn't get any. It was just not a generally pleasant experience and only got better when they noticed our table opening up our phones to review the restaurant on Yelp. Im happy they tried to redeem themselves. I just hope they improve the logistics and mechanics of their brunch.
author: Tanya Y.

description: The pictures on yelp were kind of misleading because I came for the pork buns and chilled noodles. However, I stayed because the menu was interesting and the foos turned out delicious. I got the garlic noodles and lemon pepper shrimp. Both were amazing. Would definitely come back again
author: Susannah C.

description: So delicious. Tiny restaurant but the good is AMAZING! They do a huge take out business because of its limited table number.
author: Karen L.

description:
I ordered through UberEATS for lunch and got the Korean pork tacos and the spicy garlic noodles. It was hard to narrow it down since I wanted to try everythingg, but I decided to go with what seemed the most popular items on yelp - the tacos and garlic noodles. I tried the tacos first since it probably wouldn't taste as good later, and it was really filling! I don't have a big appetite, but I though the two tacos itself would be good enough for a whole meal for me. After having the tacos I didn't have any room for the Garlic noodles, but I already saw that coming :/ i ended up only trying a bit of the garlic noodles and it was pretty good! The portion is pretty huge too, it came in a large Chinese take out box. It's probably a large enough portion to be split into two meals for me.

Overall, I probably would probably get the garlic  noodles again. I believe it was $11 for a pretty good portion and very flavorful. Although it's a little spicy for me. The tacos were also $11 I believe, for two tacos. I really like the tortilla that they use, it's different from the regular flour tortillas. The pork was pretty flavorful and also came with this orange sauce as well. The tacos were good, but I didn't think they were anything super special, so I would probably pass on that next time and try other items on the menu and get the garlic noodles again. I read about the brunch special that they had as well, I would also like to try that next time!
author: Bailey L.

description:
We had a really delicious lunch at Chubby Noodle. We ordered the fried chicken (rocky jr. chicken breasts, buttermilk brined, creamy sambal sauce), pork ramen, cauliflower, spicy garlic noodles (egg noodles, charred garlic, oyster sauce, hoisin, jalapeño, cilantro), and Korean pork tacos (don pistos' housemade flour tortilla, chili yogurt, cucumber). The total was $87 (no drinks but including tip) and was plenty of food for 3 people + a toddler.

All were delicious, and the service was great. The garlic noodles were probably my favorite, but my dining companions loved the Korean pork tacos the best.
author: K. D.

description:
I entered the restaurant hangry, because of the hike we made from the Piers and left satiated and happy. It's is a decent sized joint with friendly staff and good music. Their spicy garlic noodles are hands down the best and do not forget to get a plate of kung pao wings. I would definitely go back there probably for lunch to try their pecking duck. 

PS: Look up at the roof and you will find a huge laughing Buddha hanging over you, which i found entertaining.
author: Man0 P.

description: Have to use credit card to reserve and don't even have online reservation. Super inconvenient and lots of policy just to get a seat. Is 2017, please be digital! Here is Silicon Valley! And they don't have high chair so our friend couldn't join us eventually. I do liked the deco and concept. Feel like in a club and a fancy place. I didn't enjoyed the food because is very Americanized - very sweet and salty with heavy sauce. I can understand why is successful and they seems have lots of to-go and everyone drinking so must be profitable, but I didn't enjoy the food. We had garlic noodle, pork taco, and tuna salad. All of them looked fancy but very sweet and salty. And they even made a mistake and gave us someone else's bill.
author: Anya C.

description: Make sure to get the fried chicken and garlic noodles. The chicken is cooked perfectly, very soft and juicy. Lightly spiced thin breading that goes well with the sriracha mayonnaise type sauce. Garlic noodles taste mostly like other places; osyter sauce, garlic, butter. These however, also have jalapenos! Which really breaks up the flavor for me and makes it so I would never get tired of eating this stuff.
author: Kevin K.

description: Didn't really like this place, but it wasn't terrible. The ambience is pretty trendy with cool music but the food options are minimal and varied. The kobe beef chow mein was solid, but I didn't really like the chicken. If you are a just looking for a fun place with a cool atmosphere you will probably like it more than I did.
author: Brian F.

description: OMG! The Korean tacos!! Are you kidding me? This place is DELICIOUS! The fried chicken is moist and yummy. There is not one dish that isn't outstanding.
author: Lynnet S.

description: They have very very friendly staff and they have super cute cups :) i love their menu and how diverse they are with food. I love everything about it, just absolutely amazing. ESPECIALLY THE THROWBACK MUSIC.
author: Jenny C.

description: This was the first time dining at the North Beach location as I had gone to the Marina location.  Though we often order from Cavier and other delivery device for work, but this was the my first time dining inside. They serve the same dishes and they taste just as I remembered. We ordered the garlic noodles, chow mein, and kung pow wings. They each had its own flavor, which I love. The service though was a bit slow. They only had one waiter and he was busy taking orders. We had a hard time flagging others down.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Chubby Noodle  is my go-to easy no frills place to take friends and family for a delicious local bite.  Pricey for small plates but the flavors make the  worth it!
author: Fawn M.

description: My friend and I ordered the spicy garlic noodles and the BBQ pork (cha siu) fried rice, and both were delicious! The noodles had the right amount of flavor to them, and the pork in the fried rice was very flavorful. At first, it didn't seem to be a lot of food but ordering a noodles dish and a rice dish provided enough for both of us.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I love Chubby Noodle.

It's great for date night with plates to share (great for flirting). It's great for bottomless brunch with friends. The food is awesome, the music is BOMB (the playlist is called chubbyfire on Spotify), and the service is on point.

Bottomless brunch is particularly worth it. It's $37 for all you can eat and all you can drink. If someone can find a better deal then that, please message me right now. They don't penalize you if you can't finish what you've ordered (which feels wasteful, but is appreciated). I never once saw the bottom of my mimosa. They made a sangria that my friends also enjoyed. You also get a cute little rubber duck that floats in your drink. Start your collections now!
author: Alice L.

description: Brunch = BOMB! Bottomless food and drinks for 90 minutes? Yes please! Their Watermelon mimosa was delicious and had a little rubber ducky floating in it... cute! We came in on a Saturday at a little after 11am and were able to get seated right away the bar. You can make a reservation for parties larger than 3-4 I believe. They have a good selection of food included in their bottomless brunch. My only tiny complaint is that it didn't include their delicious garlic noodles, WHY!?! Duck buns, pork wantons and chicken noodle dishes were my fave. All in all we had 4+ drinks each and more than enough food for $39 each not including tip/tax... not a bad deal and definitely worth it. Would come back here again!
author: Alex S.

description:
So I let myself get hungry to the point that I basically inhaled my food when it came. Hence, no pics. But! The food was soooooo good. I felt it in my toes. Anyway, I came here on a Monday evening around 8. It didn't appear crowded, but we had limited seating options as people made reservations and hadn't shown up yet. It took them a long time to get us drinks and take our orders (which is why I took off one star), but once they got everything in, they were pretty attentive from that point on. 

My friend and I shared three dishes and I also got the spicy garlic noodle (can you say leftovers bruh?). The serving sizes were great for sharing too. The three dishes I mentioned before were the fried chicken (4 stars), the ribs (5 stars), and the pork tacos (5 stars). I took one star off for the fried chicken because they were basically nuggets. The nuggets were yummy as hell, but still nuggets. Overall, the flavors across the dishes were really complex, but well balanced. For example, I loved the heat on the pork tacos paired with the cool cucumber. You should definitely try this place for yourself. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Sharese K.

description:
Fun place for bottomless drinks and food! You pay ~$50 (including tip and tax) for as much food as you want and as many mimosas/beers. It is pricey, but come hungry! 

I actually really enjoyed the food here along with the drinks. The shrimp is great, as well as the wonton and kimchi ramen. Get some green beans to feel healthy as well:) all included. 

I had pineapple and watermelon mimosas, both delicious. Service was a bit slow at first, but after speaking with the waiter we received food much faster. Thank you!
author: Caley Z.

description: Hubby and I did not make reservations -which is recommended- fortunately for us the bar was empty that night. The bartender was very hospitable and professional, & made a few recommendations, and so we went for it. All of it. Other items weren't pictured, but were equally delicious as those that are.
author: Ryanne C.

description:
This place is pretty hyped up so I had high expectations and was very disappointed.  Went for lunch on a weekday and the service was terrible.  It was pretty full yet there aren't that many tables so not sure what the underlying problem was.  It took a very long time just to have the opportunity to get drinks ordered at which point we ordered food too.  The food took a long time to come and each of us got our entrees ~3 minutes apart which is never a good thing.  Even worse was that the (over priced) sake flights actually came after the food.  Kind of ridiculous it took nearly 30 minutes for them to pour three shots.  

The food itself was good, not great.  I got the spicy garlic noodles with fried chicken added to it.  The spicy garlic noodles were good but not spicy.  It was almost like eating normal chow mein.  The fried chicken was definitely the highlight but they didn't add a very generous amount of fried chicken to the noodles.  If I go back (definitely not anytime soon) I'd get the fried chicken entree and skip the sake.
author: george c.

description:
nailed it. 
   the space. 
    the food.
    the music.
     thee idea.
  i was blown away! a prefix "bottomless brunch?" 
it's so worth it. it's fun! and exciting... you consistently are getting food and drinks. they have cute rubber ducky's in your cocktail? need i say more??  a hangover turned into a roll-over. any one of you that are foodies, and like cocktails.  GO  you're so missing out of you don't.
author: Samantha B.

description: I love brunch in general, but this place is one of my usual brunch spots for when I want to bottomless drinks!  I always tend to get the same server when i'm there, Danica! She's super sweet, and attentive. We've been there a few hectic Sundays and she remembers us, which is a PLUS. I honestly love her, but the staff and food in general is amazing. I recommend  weekend brunch with a group of friends or your significant other if yall tryna get down for no reason! (:
author: Stephanie H.
