description: The portions at this place are ridiculously small. The ramen was not even sized for a small child. It didn't even taste good. I will not be returning ever again. Do not come here unless you want to get ripped off and leave as hungry as you were when you entered
author: Ryan Q.

description:
Liked it very much - have been wanting to try forever.

Pros: 
* Oil can asahi - BIG, as they say!
* Food came out VERY fast - was a plus for eating with impatient kids
* tonkotsu ramen was quite good, esp the broth
* Very nice and attentive service

Cons: 
* No egg as promised in my ramen, and i LOVE ramen eggs!
* Food came out almost too fast - makes me worry a lot of stuff is pre-made, though that's okay in certain cases
* Bathroom in an awkward spot in the kitchen, long lines because only one unisex restroom

Overall, a lovely lunch - will return
author: Erica W.

description: Food and alcohol are extremely good but SERVICE SUCKS. Our server was sour from the beginning. On top of that, our reservation was 2-3:30 and they cut us off at 3 without warning. Even the table beside us got angry and frustrated. Efficiency is NOT present here. Manager actually had to have a pow wow in front of customers cause of all the frustrations thrown around. Too bad cause the brunch buffet is good.
author: Fran A.

description:
Not a fan of this place, it's dark, and they play loud a$$ music. If I wanted to go to a damn club, I would just go to a club, why would I want to come here?!?! Came here because I wanted to try this new spot in the area, but I def won't be coming back! 
Ordered the sashimi for the appetizer, fried rice, a beer, and a bowl of ramen. The food was not good and the service was terrible. The total came out to be 60 (tip included). Fu** this place, never coming back here again.
author: Q W.

description: Delicious family style food, highly recommend the tuna poke. Some of the dishes are fairly spicy but you can ask for less spice. Sake flights are fun to share. Noodles with fried chicken is a must have and the Korean pork tacos were also great. The seating is a little tight but you can make it work and the servers are very friendly.
author: Becca B.

description: My wife and I ordered two salads and noodles through Caviar. Neither of our salads were dressed. It's just super frustrating because we paid like $10+ for each salad and they were both tasteless and inedible. Don't use Caviar as they did not help resolve the issue at all! Also, Chubby Noodle should not use if they can't correctly complete an order. Overall cost was $51, and all Caviar offered was a $5 credit. Problem with both is Caviar is an ineffective middle man, and Chubby didn't accurately compete our order.
author: Michael G.

description:
Great Food! Great Drinks too!
And chubby noodle for you
Sake to go please 

Girlfriend and I ordered the chow meaning and Singaporean noodles. The gf is a fan of glass noodles, I don't think it let her down. I also thoroughly enjoyed the chow mein, a step or two up from your local Chinese fast food joint. Great service as well. Be sure to buy a drink or two.
author: Richard W.

description: Wow, we had quite the experience here.  Last weekend we called in about 30 minutes prior to our arrival and we were able to secure a reservation for 5 people. We were quickly seated, and received very prompt service. The family style dining provided the perfect opportunity to try a lot of the amazing items on the menu.  The fried chicken was great, the creamy dipping sauce that it comes with is truly something else. The spicy garlic noodles were also a favorite item that we ordered. We also tried the Korean pork tacos, as well as the pork fried rice and Szechuan green beans. We washed it all down with a really nice sake, Ozeki. It was a nice unfiltered and delicious sake. The music was a bit loud, and quite a line formed outside. The price point is also a bit high, but none of these reasons will prevent me from coming back here in the future.
author: Alex E.

description:
We came here in a group of 5 for brunch. Overall, I left pretty happy.

Format: $37 brunch for 90 minutes of unlimited food and drinks.

Service: We were one of the few diners in the restaurant that morning, so this may not be reflective of an experience during peak hours, but we had an absolutely great experience with service. Friendly waiters, constantly checking on whether you wanted more food and refilling your drinks; a manager, friendly and genuine. My only issue is that we requested a sampling of the entire menu, and there were a few dishes that were left out. Not a big deal though, because we were definitely full enough. 

Drinks: Fun brunch drinks with small rubber ducks. Constantly topped off and pretty tasty overall. They had an interesting selection of house-branded sakes and wines that I definitely intend on trying next time.

Food: This restaurant offers a great mix of Asian fusion dishes and a menu just large enough to keep everyone happy. The food is filling and tasty, and it's hard to knock them for quality when this is an all-you-can-eat place.
author: Kevin S.

description: Came here for my first time tonight and totally liked the vibe. Good music, nice furniture and ambiance and great service. I am giving it 4 stars because I wasn't a huge fan of the ramen. I can't be too picky about it because I realize it isn't a ramen joint but there just wasn't that much flavor in the broth and the noodles were a bit too al dente for me. I did love the fried chicken and the Szechwan green beans. Oh, and another downfall was the $10 can of Aooha IPA. I would come back and try more for sure!
author: Brittany G.

description: Chubby noodle is my favorite Go-to food in north beach.  The menu is small but everything is good. The service is always great and there's always fun music playing with a great overall environment to match. I am a regular here and will continue to be, would recommend it to anyone. I think I've had everything on the menu and can't think of what's my favorite because it's all so damn good!
author: Rachel M.

description: Nice ambience, not so good food.  Small portions and the flavor was absent! A bit disappointed, service is ok.
author: Ximena S.

description: Loved their fried chicken! The korean tacos and garlic noodles were delicious too. Very friendly and attentive staff, however, I wasn't a big fan of their atmosphere.
author: Sui N.

description: This place has a very limited menu with only a few options, I tried to taste all of the foods but all the dishes were very average and salty....not good at all. The table is really small so it is hard to eat out of it. It is totally over priced, 37/pp not including tips and tax. With this money you can have a much more decent meal anywhere else with real foods. It is all you can eat but really there is not much you can eat out the limited menu they have.
author: An N.

description: I made reservations for a party of 10 a couple of weeks prior to our visit. It was for my birthday and we chose the AYCE/AYCD option. The food was really good, but the service and food portioning for AYCE for such a big group was HORRIBLE. For a restaurant that's so small, with more than enough servers and only serves the same items for every table, you would think they would serve you in a timely manner. Mind you, we are given a 90 minute time limit and the server was already telling us it was last call for food before our last itemS had even been served to us. I would definitely rather have spent our $600+ elsewhere to get more authentic dim sum and probably spend way less. Two stars for the food that we got to enjoy and one of the servers who filled up our drinks after our time limit passed.
author: Desiree D.

description: Such a fun, little place! The food was good and definitely on the more reasonable side for the city. My friends and I all split a few entrees to get a taste of everything and all of the food was good! I particularly recommend the pork tacos, but I don't think you can go wrong at this little joint. The atmosphere was also enjoyable with good music, good service, and all around cool vibes
author: Emily D.

description:
Superb New Asian cross-over food. Shared 5 dishes, all of them delicious: salmon sashimi, garlic noodles, fried chicken, green beans (wow!) and pork tacos. Try the San Francisco Kolsch beer.
Staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our dinner.
author: Mario G.

description:
Atmosphere -- young crowd and in an area with lots of bars nearby. Staff is energetic and chill and great music (hip hop and throwbacks). 

Food -- fried chicken really hits the spot. Well fried and crispy. Also got spicy garlic noodles, which were flavorful, chewy and not super oily. 

Great spot to grab dinner then bar hop in the neighborhood. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Jenny J.

description:
Great experience! The place is a bit small, but creates an intimate atmosphere and is well decorated.

This location has a sushi menu, and it's pretty awesome. The hamachi plate is perfection especially with a glass of their sake they call "the bad boy"! The sushi chef is also super friendly and added to the experience :)
author: Cheri K.

description: Ok a very friendly waitress adorned in Oakland Raider garb mixed in with 90's hip hop set the tone for a really fun time- the food was excellent and the youthful energy of this place is intoxicating. Really fun. Go with a group
author: Paul M.

description:
We love Chubby Marina, so we were delighted when Nick and Pete opened the second Chubby in North Beach. Went there Saturday, and I think I am still in a food coma.

First, the build-out is great. Lots of light, noise is not over the top, seems bright and airy. Second, the food is just flat out delicious and yummy. Ahi Poke, Korean Pork tacos, meatballs, ceviche - meow. I was one happy kitty!

Service was excellent. The staff was attentive without being over the top, which I appreciate. Nick and Pete have hit it out of the park again. Congrats, guys!
author: Robyn W.

description: Came here on a Sunday with my girlfriends for lunch. I love the concept of unlimited dim sum but the menu was very limited and I wish there were more dim sum like dishes. As for bottomless drinks - you can totally tell the alcohol was watered down which really upset me because the bill was pretty expensive. The least they can do is make the drink a little strong. The service was amazing, I love how attentive our server was. Thanks for an amazing meal minus the weak alcoholic drink
author: Judy T.

description: I've eaten here about 4 times, and our experience has been a little worse each return. Our first couple of visits were great - attentive, warm service, delicious and exciting tapas style asian food. The food has since remained solid, though the last time we ate here the menu was a little less interesting and ambitious than it had been earlier, and it was uniformly spicy. My major beef with this place is the loud club music, which became more strident each time we visited. It's impossible to have a conversation. I get it for the brunch party atmosphere, but maybe 6pm on a Sunday evening they could tone it down for those of us who like to hear each other once in a while? The last time we came I felt so bludgeoned by the music and tired of straining to hear that I decided it wasn't worth a return, no matter the food quality.
author: Emily M.

description: This meal was absolutely perfect. Just the right amount of spice on the garlic noodles, the poke tuna was tasty and so fresh. The atmosphere was lively with modern music and attentive staff.
author: Gemma H.

description: Came here for brunch to celebrate a friend's birthday. I was really excited because I've been to the Marina location before and absolutely loved it. The North Beach Chubby Noodle really fell short. Our food took forever and we kept getting the same dishes, while watching all the tables around us get bombarded with food. The food also was no where near as good as the Marina location. When they told us we only had 30 minutes left at our table, we were shocked and annoyed because we still hadn't received half our menu items. They were super busy so it's not their fault, I'm sure it's not easy to keep track of which tables have received what dishes. The guys working there were extremely nice and we appreciated the shots that came out with a birthday candle.
author: Felicia D.

description:
At first we were a little skeptical of the limited food menu since it was all small plates. But every dish we ordered had amazing flavor and the staff were incredibly friendly and fun.

I highly recommend the Yellowtail Sashimi and Chubby Fried Chicken.

Definitely coming back!
author: Jess T.

description: Let's just start off by saying this place is amazing! A group of friends and myself went to Saturday brunch here and had an amazing experience! We went on a rainy Saturday afternoon and the place was packed and blasting hip hop classics! How can you go wrong with that?! After about a 10 minute wait, we were able to get seats at the bar and we were immediately greeted by the bartender. He explained the entire brunch menu to us and recommended some of his favorites for us to start off with. The pecking duck as A-MA-ZING!! IT as crispy, moist, and just delicious! The green beans, noodles, and dumplings were also some of our favorites. The bartender ( I believe his name was Julian) entertained us the entire time. I would recommend this place through and through! If you enjoy great hip hop, a pleasant staff, and flavorful food; this is the place to go!
author: Anthony H.

description:
I really only come here for one thing - the Chubby Fried Chicken. Honestly, it's amazing. I could eat it 7 days a week. 

The pork tacos are also pretty yummy - but only two? One of the times I came they came with some chili oil or other spicy sauce on the side. This past time, none :/. 

Most of the time this spot is good, but don't expect too much. Earlier today when I was there with my friend, our server blatantly stopped listening to my him (this is while they were talking about something on the menu) to wave at her friend through the window. After finishing her 10 second smile/wave she turned back to my friend and said, "Sorry can you just ask that again?" Come on girl, just try to keep it professional!
author: Ainslee S.

description:
This is my new favorite spot in north beach. The food is amazing and the staff is SO friendly in the most genuine way possible. So many places in SF that are good get jaded and the waitstaff turn into assholes.. I hope this place stays cool forever! Literally every waiter, hostess, bus boy, etc that we encountered was nice and friendly and awesome, so much so that I decided to come home and write this post. 

As for the food - we got the meatball skewers, cucumber salad, and the duck buns and everything was amazing. No complaints whatsoever about this place! 

Stay humble, chubby noodle
author: Sarah M.

description: Yennifer was a bomb waitress.  Some people complain about it not being breakfast food... it's dim sum!  It's still good and bottomless food and drink for 90 minutes is super reasonable.
author: Paul C.

description: Have this place a second chance this time at the North Beach location. I really wanted to like the Marina location but I think I like the vibe at the North Beach location more! Our hostess/server was amazing. She was super friendly and engaging and made sure that we were comfortable. The memorable dish that makes like this place when we went to the other location were the tacos! Still . The salmon sashimi was really good too. The sauce really went well with the sashimi. As we say and waited for our ramen, which sadly isn't as good as I would like to think, was the fried chicken!  sooo good especially cause it comes out fresh and crispy! So crispy! The other thing that I really want to try is the steam buns..the table next to us got an order.. And it made me want to order it but we were waiting for the fish filet. For the fish filet... The shitake mushrooms are sooo yummy and flavorful but the fish was just a filet of tilapia...I think it would be better if it was bass but that would be a fish that my mommy makes.  she probably makes it perfectly how I like it too. All in all a good dinner not the best. And next time I might just order it online cause their to go orders are way faster than sit-ins..
author: Fanny C.

description: WARNING!! Check your card statement. I was charged more than I actually signed for. I wonder how often they get away with this kind of thing... pretty crooked business.
author: Camille d.

description: Yennifer was the best waitress! So attentive and and da bomb! The food was amazing as well!
author: Kendall S.

description: Went here for brunch and it was incredible. I loved the unique take on bunch with the incorporation of American Chinese food especially the green beans and shrimp. The service was wonderful. The ambiance is casual and fun with a bomb hip hop playlist. I will definitely be back soon for dinner as I've heard that's even better than the brunch.
author: Kelli C.

description: Very average place. Ramen is good, if unremarkable. Chicken strips are your standard frozen crap. When you order delivery, if you ask for extra sauce (which is tasty) they will most likely ignore you and instead send a tiny little half-plastic cup of it for your box of $12 defrosted chicken strips.
author: Kyle P.

description: Such a fun place. Excellent service, the food is so yummy and they play the JAMS. Highly recommended, especially for brunch.
author: Jim T.

description:
I'm not giving this place 5 stars because Nick the owner is one of the most genuinely nicest and hard-working guys I know. 

Chubby Noodle deserves my 5 stars because they've mastered the elusive trifecta of merging quality food, approachable atmosphere, and perception of value. Unlike other nearby options, you can tell that they want to earn your repeat business. And that's just fine by me.

Using quality ingredients in their asian street-food inspired small plates against the backdrop of hip-hop spanning from the 80's to contemporary, they've honed their craft and found their crowd. 

Nestled amongst the Irish and dive bars that predominantly caters to single 20 and 30 something crowds looking for a some rowdy fun, Chubby knows their audience and isn't afraid to show you a good time. 
Their food is consistently solid, and their menu is playful enough and they're variety of options including vegetarian offers something for each of your fickle friends.

I've seen this place grow a following over the last 2 years. Try it out now while you don't have to put your name down for an hour wait.
author: Xandria S.

description: Not bad but that could be better ! I enjoyed the pork bun, it was very good but the tuna poke was served with asian chips... I think it will be better With rice ! Service was great and the price are ok.
author: Minh Duc T.

description:
Flavorful bites served in an energetic ambiance. Nick&Pete have done this North Beach Hood a Solid!
#GarlicNoodles
author: yvette c.

description: Very very strict with the time limits even if their store was not at full capacity. Kept clearing our glasses consistently. Mimosas were watered down, but food was very good. Try the salt and pepper shrimp!
author: Stephen C.

description: Asian meets Mexican food all in one place. Only lacks hard liquor but the food definitely makes up for it. Sake we had was very good.
author: David S.

description: You need the spicy garlic noodles in your life. Cute place with a small but amazing menu!!
author: Julia G.

description: Perhaps my favorite restaurant in the city. The rap music creates a hip ambiance and the staff is great. The garlic noodles and pork tacos are out of this world. Disregard the health warning - Chubby Noodle is a must.
author: Parker W.

description: It's loud and small but the food is amazing and the music playing was awesome. Will definitely come back.
author: Joe M.

description: First timer and highly recommended! The ambience, service and food are worth coming back from SoCal. Definitely try their Tuna Poke, Spicy Garlic Noodles, BBQ Fried Rice w/fried egg, Korean Pork Tacos and Steamed Pork Buns. Props to the music playlist bumping while we were chowing down... Genius!
author: Leo A.

description:
I had a mix up with this North Beach location and the Marina location.  It was completely my fault but the staff and managers really went above and beyond to help me.  Very impressive staff, very kind, helpful, prompt and just fantastic.

I ordered the Spicy Garlic Noodles and the Pork Tacos, both were phenomenal!  I am so excited that they opened this location right around the corner from my house.  Very fun, loud and lively environment.  I can't wait to become a regular here!  

Thanks again for the over the top great service!!!
author: Jillian C.

description:
This place is my go to spot for good food, good fun and good company. The fried chicken, Korean tacos, garlic noodles and sashimi are my favorite dishes. 

The staff is very personable and the menu has something for everyone. Their house sake is great and their beer selection will not disappoint. If you're looking for a fun and lively dinner to kick off your night out in North Beach then Chubby is the spot.
author: Kourosh Z.

description:
Food was just ok...def not worth what we paid for it. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried rice and since the waitress said it was family style, we thought we would be able to share. NOPE. It looked like a side dish! Then, the guy clearing our table spilled sauce all over my friend, and instead of apologizing, dude just stood there and asked if he was ok. The waitress, bless her heart but probably can't do a proper load of laundry, brought my friend a kitchen towel on a plate and said she put sanitizer on it so he could wipe off his pants. NO THANKS. I'm willing to bet money that whatever sanitizer that comes from the kitchen isn't intended to come into contact with skin, much less my friend's pants. Then, the waitress brought us 4 shots of sake on the house. I know her intentions were well but coming from the hospitality industry, one shouldn't assume that alcohol is going to make everything ok. I don't drink sake at all, and another in our group is allergic to alcohol. So basically, nothing was resolved. 

Definitely won't be back.
author: Larissa H.

description: Never in my life have I had a waiter request more money on a 15% tip. Total assholes. Don't come here unless you expect to pay 20% for terrible service.
author: Christine B.

description: Food and sake were fine. Service was fine -- until we asked the waitress to lower the volume of the hip hop pounding out from the speaker right over our 18" x 24" table. "I'll ask, but they usually won't do that." They wouldn't. We had ordered 3 small plates, intending to order more, but we ate, paid, and left as quickly as possible, never to return. If you're so arrogant and ignorant that you'd rather lose business than give up your tunes, you shouldn't be running a restaurant. We walked across Grant Ave to Ideale, shared an entree and dessert, and lingered over wine in the quiet, professional ambiance. Evening rescued.
author: Laura R.

description: I came here for lunch, arrived not very hungry and ordered two hand rolls. I get it, they're hand rolls, but they really skimp on the fillings. I left with my wallet $18 lighter ($15 + tip) and even more hungry than I arrived. You'll have to order at least 3-4 items on the menu to feel somewhat full, and at that rate you might as well try Original Joe's or even Don Pistos. This place used to be a Pistos, and I miss those (reasonably priced, yet delicious) tacos.
author: Neesh B.

description: Food was awesome, the vibe and music was great too. So good that I brought a group the next night. Sizzling Fish was definitely a highlight! Pork Fried Rice and Beef Chow Mein need more flavour but everything else was delicious.
author: Courtney F.

description: Not impressed by this place AT ALL. The food is over priced and comes in small portions even though the server said everything is "family style". It's more like tapas/happy hour portions. Homie who cleared our table flung sauce all over my husband and didn't apologize at all. The name of the place is deceiving as there's only 2 noodle dishes on the menu. The only thing chubby about this place is the bill.  Definitely not coming back or recommend it.
author: Amie T.

description: Hip vibe. The shrimp pad tai was excellent . Recommend the cucumber sparkling soda. Great service. I liked the basic menu with a pan Asian influence .
author: Julie C.

description: Oh my god - the chubby fried chicken ... order them you will never regret these moreish strips of heavenly scrumptiousness!
author: Noor A.

description: I love this place so much but God the service sucks. Food is 9/10 but if you are hungry don't come because they care more about the dine out then the eat Ins which is annoying coming from a former waitress. Service is important and I don't think I'll ever dine in again.
author: Ellen H.

description: This place was a dream come true. If your dreams are like mine and are full of delicious ass poke and garlic noodles and ratchet rap music. Chubby noodle is my new favorite spot to go in San Francisco - I hope to be back very soon!
author: Kenny D.

description: Food is good but service was very poor. Also the music is super loud and explicit. Won't be going back or recommending it to friends.
author: A S.

description: Went here on a Thursday night to grab dinner. Got seated right away by friendly staff, who continued to be friendly the  night through. We ordered the fried chicken, garlic noodles and pork steamed buns. The fried chicken was fresh, crispy, and delicious. The sauce it came with was perfect. The garlic noodles were my favorite-- hint of spice but not too much, and packed with delicious garlicy flavor. The steamed buns had sweet and juice pork on fluffy steamed buns. Everything was delicious and we were completely satisfied!!
author: Christina W.

description: Service was bad, they took over 30 minutes to bring us our food, the tables around us that came in after us got food before us. Steve our waiter didn't bring us our chubby rice, when we told him he was missing a plate he said "oh i didn't take that order" so since we were upset we asked for the check. In the check he charged us for the chubby rice. We approached him to tell him he made a mistake and he told us "oh well u got the chubby chicken" to which we had to clarify we did not order or received. Overall the food we tried was good but with the terrible service we got i will think again before coming back to this place.
author: Paloma D.

description: Save your appetite & cash !! Panda Express would have been 10x better. We had the Tonkatsu Ramen NO FLaVoR ( cup of noodle has more ) Garlic noodle and Kobe beef chow mien SMH. The frozen one's at Trader Joe's would be my recommendation. I don't even know how this place got a 4.5 star review let alone be open to the public for food . WORST food I've ever had. Giving it a No stars.  Had to give it a one star to Post . Disregard please !!!
author: So V.

description:
I will start by saying that our servers were amazing and the food was outstanding. However, something happened that completely ruined our experience. 

While we were eating we were approached by a woman selling grapes. We kindly declined but the owner at the door had a young girl who was working (who was much younger than legal working age), go outside and take the grapes from the woman. The woman was confused waiting for them to pay her, but they clearly weren't going to pay her. We gave her $10 and she was on her way. After she left the owner threw the grapes (that we had paid for) into the street. We were in complete disbelief that the owner was so heartless. We understand that this woman might have seemed to be harassing us but we were not bothered by her at all! We asked him why he did what he did and were asked to leave. He also called our friend "fat." Good one! When she told him that there are people starving who could use these grapes he simply stated that he didn't care. 

I refuse to ever come to this establishment ever again. I cannot believe how heartless this business owner is. I absolutely loved the food and service but can never get over how awful the owner is. If you have a heart and respect people in the city trying to make  a living (even the ones selling grapes on the street), you won't come here.
author: Liza G.

description: A friend suggested we try this restaurant, which is on my favorite stretch of Grant Avenue - Upper Grant above Columbus. It's a beautiful street with much of the old character preserved, plenty of holiday lighting, and lots of great restaurants, including Cafe Jacqueline and Ideale. Chubby Noodle is sort of Asian fusion cuisine with a side of hip-hop soundtrack. Definitely not in your Old San Francisco tradition. But the wait staff was really nice, and the food was generally delicious. We started by splitting some of the garlic-y green beans, which were very tasty. Wine was reasonably priced and quite good. We also tried garlic noodles, which were good, but not my favorite. I had the tuna poke as an appetizer and really liked it - and I have tried quite a few poke bowls by now. Best of all was the fried chicken. Not bone-in chicken as you'd usually find at a restaurant, but more like tonkatsu-style chicken cutlets.  Absolutely delicious. And then, to top everything off, our waitress brought us small complimentary glasses of sake.  Next time, I think I'd choose sake for my drink, as it went remarkably well with the fried chicken.
author: Lira K.

description: They really do have the best fried chicken I've ever had. I could eat it for 16 straight days. The sashimi was terrific, ambience was strong and the service was on point. I look forward to my next meal here.
author: Joe G.

description: I think this place has a fun concept, definitely different then other places. Young, hipster vibe. The food tastes good, a fun place for groups with all you can eat / drink feature. Even though it's noted that 4 drinks max are included, we definitely were served more. Several issues to note, however. Service is pretty bad. In part, there's a lot of people to serve. I imagine parties have many demands that waiters have to attend to (and I know food service industry is a tough job); however, knowing this they need increase their staffing, or at least, train their staff to be more attentive to parties. Another issue to note is that all our party members got sick. Onset: 6-7 hours after having eaten here. We don't know specifically what food item was the culprit, however, we know we got it from this place - all 10 of us got symptoms of food poisoning. Lastly, music is SO loud don't expect to be able to catch up with friends without losing your voice. Even our server noted she couldn't even hear us to take our order because of the music. Although fun concept, I won't be back. Bye Felicia.
author: Danny B.

description: This location makes the garlic noodles PERFECT. I always get the green beans and the garlic noodles.  Very delicious and the noodles are SPICY. not fake spicy.
author: Emoni M.

description:
Others have wrote this but let me reiterate:

-Great food
-Amazing Staff
-Inappropriate owner

I won't get into details but I'll never give this place my business again.  After seeing how he treated another group I think the restaurant would be better off not having him there on a day-to-day basis.

Also, it's $14 for a 33oz Asahi that you can pick up for $4 on the next corner. You would think buying more would be cheaper but you can get 3x Sapporo's (36oz) for $15 instead. 

Math game is weak.
author: Ted S.

description: Ordered the chicken with green beans from Caviar. It was so flavorless and mushy with only a few tiny pieces of chicken. Hopefully the rest of their food isn't this bad.
author: Ms. G.

description: Delicious food, friendly people, and an utterly accessible (but not exactly cheap) dining experience. There are lots of unique and tasty items on the menu, but the standouts IMHO are the tuna poke salad and the hand rolls. What makes me laugh is when they offer their fried chicken as if it's a garnish. I ordered garlic noodles, and they countered with, "would you like some fried chicken to top it off?" (Both the noodles and the chicken are also delicious BTW)
author: Angelo B.

description: Yay they got their own location! Can't not get the fried chicken and spicy garlic noodles. Excited to frequent this spot for great food & convenient drinks.
author: Melissa R.

description: Great atmosphere. Great food, great service, great people. I went here on a Friday, it was poppin. I was seated promptly and taken care of. Had the two new editions to their menu; steamed pork buns and curry soup, dank!
author: David L.

description: Chicken Tacos are some of the best in the city. Garlic noodles are also solid with tons of flavor.
author: Aaron C.

description: The rudest waitress and staff ever!!! I was the first person in the restaurant and they barely paid any attention to my table. Instead they were more concerned partying with each other than doing their job. Also the music was insanely loud at 5:30pm and they refused to turn it down even though we were the only table there and we literally couldn't hear each other across the table. When I asked if they could turn it down she rolled her eyes and then of course never turned it down.
author: Sal H.

description: Steven and Leo gave our party the best experience. Great drinks and food and I have not one negative thing to say. We loved it!
author: Kaitlyn C.

description: First time eating here and I must say everything about this place is awesome from the music and good customer service plus they give you a free Chinese shot which is pretty good and smooth. And last the food was perfect I ordered the Korean pork tacos which we the best tacos I had so far, and I also ordered the chubby chicken. If you guys like good food and customer service then come here they will take care of you.
author: Ryan R.

description: After eating here I had the worst diarrhea ever. Convinced it was CN because the rest of the food I ate that day wasn't out of the norm and I was used to it. Plus it was late night, no one was there and I felt a type of dgaf attitude coming from the service team.
author: Maximilian K.

description:
Meh. I've experienced better. This is exactly what I feel about this restaurant. SO many people. So many people tell me what a great place this is. So I went in with pretty high standards. The first time I went to Chubby Noodle was with my boyfriend. We love asian fusion food but right when we got there, we realized this is honestly not that big of a restaurant and more of a "bar" restaurant. The menu ( very limited) was as small and simple as an in n out menu. We ordered ramen ( priced at 16?) and some fried chicken. We were not full and the bill was already around 40 bucks. The fried chicken was more like chicken tenders and there was only 5-6 small slices for us to share. The ramen tasted funky because of the broth and we were quickly able to finish them both cause they weren't that big. We could have easily ordered more food but it would have been around 60 for two people. I am ok with that but the food didn't taste amazing so why would we order more? We finished and left and went to buy other food for the remainder of our dinner. 

This place is overpriced with mediocre food and small portions. The worst kind of combination for a restaurant, right?
author: Eileen W.

description: Up in SF for the weekend from SD; found this place on our adventure through the city.....this place is AMAZING!!!! The vibe here is chill and the food is delicious, our waiter Steven was on point, the staff is on top of their game and the chefs know what they're doing!! Definitely making it a point to come back to this restaurant when I'm back in SF; well worth the money!!!
author: Julie S.

description: So good. Had the ramen which was top 5 in the city. Also had the Hamachi sashimi which was pretty thick cut but pretty good. Reay great vibe and menu.
author: David K.

description: We had spicy garlic noodles, steam duck buns and Korean tacos. Everything was really good! We saw the food other table ordered, all looked really delicious! We will be back to try every other dish in the future.
author: Min G.

description: Amazing beer, great service and the Korean tacos are to die for. Highly recommend this place!
author: Graham G.

description: So excited about the new Chubby Noodle location in North Beach. Went in a few weeks ago and had a fantastic time. I love the fun atmosphere and the beautiful interior. The service was awesome and the food was great. I love their fried chicken, pork tacos and the heirloom salad - all incredibly delicious! I was also happy to see the Push Back Sauvignon Blanc was being served here, my favorite white wine. Looking forward to trying more things on the menu and will definitely come back soon. Cheers to Pete and Nick - another success!
author: Kelly K.

description: I'm so disappointed because I was looking forward to this meal all day. But we ordered take out and for one thing the girl didn't let us know when the food was out she just left it on the table, we had to ask for the drink that we ordered that was supposed to come with it and then when we got home we realized the most important and expensive thing we bought wasn't even there. It was the duck lettuce wraps and all we got were the lettuce pieces so we paid $$ for a couple of pieces of lettuce.....
author: Joanne T.

description: Food was outstanding!  Friendly server Travis also very good. Would have gotten 5 stars if 12 year old son had not been with us while "official chubby north" Spotify list was playing (which I'm now following BTW!). Left very little to the imagination...
author: jim l.

description: Awesome! Tried to go to Don Pistos but they were crowded so we came here & they were awesome! Fried chicken, pork tacos, green beans, garlic noodles, & salmon sashimi were all delicious! I can't get over how tasty everything was- & the servers were so polite & happy too. Totally recommend this place for a date night or with friends.
author: robin h.

description: Probably my favorite, go-to restaurant in the city.  I probably go once a week.  I almost always get the Spicy Garlic Noodles, Korean Pork Tacos, and the Fried Chicken.....all soooo good.
author: Justin H.

description: The pork ramen is great! Although it was a bit spicy for me, it was perfect for a colder day. The noodles and soft boiled egg were perfect! The broth was tasty and pure; it was not thick or greasy. I'd would definitely order the ramen again and am excited to try other items in the menu next time.  Btw, the music they played while i was here on a Saturday afternoon were oldies pop and rockabilly; I thought a Japanese greaser was gonna show up anytime during my meal... It was good music!
author: Dee Y.

description: This place was amazing, great food, great music, and the customer service was awesome! Definitely coming back next time I'm up here in San Francisco!:)
author: Toby Z.

description: The SO and I had the pleasure of dining here for the first time last night. Walking in around 8:30 we were seated right away. While we reviewed the menu our waitress came over to take drinks orders and offer up recommendations (we've only been to the Chubby Noodle Pop-up so the menu has several new items along with the staples). We ordered the Duck Jook, Korean Pork Tacos, Japanese Meatball skewer and Calamari skewer to share. Everything was delicious but the Duck Jook and the tacos were out of this world. Duck Jook is what I want a big steamy bowl of on a rainy day. Or any kind of day really. One thing I'd like to note: After having gum surgery recently, I am unable to bite into foods presently which proves a bit difficult with tacos, burgers, sandwiches, etc which means I have to cut said items with a knife and fork (not my favorite). Upon request of a knife and fork (which makes me feel a bit ridiculous) our waitress didn't even bat an eye at this  request which I really appreciated. All of the staff we came into contact with were very attentive, accommodating and just downright friendly. Great spot, great people and delicious food! Will definitely be back to try everything else we didn't try this time around.
author: Emily S.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite. Had the korean tacos and a beer. Really tasty food and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
author: m m.

description: A woman friend and I planned to have lunch at Chubby Noodle last week, but when we got there they were playing loud rap music with offensive lyrics in their very small, confined space. We asked if there was any chance the music could be changed, and they said no, so we went to another place in the neighborhood. So I obviously can't review the food, but I don't think loud, misogynistic rap is advisable for a neighborhood lunch place, no matter how cool the staff wants to think they are.
author: Carolyn M.

description: This place is amazing. I've been to the Marina location plenty of times and I tried this location to see if they could preserve the same experience. They did!! It's incredible. The food is just as good and the people just as amazing. If you get a chance to meet Steve the bartender, ask him about the best Sakes. John is the sushi chef and he does an amazing job with the sashimi. I really enjoy this place and recommend anyone coming here.
author: Eric Z.

description: If you're in SF and don't eat here, your crazy...EVERYTHING on the menu is AMAZING and plates are the perfect size, enjoy!
author: Steve R.

description: Absolutely phenomenal. Food was unreal, ambiance was fantastic and the service was great. Pork tacos were so good. Garlic noodles off the chain. Owner was there and was coming around to every table to talk. Best part honestly might be the late 90s early 2000s rap music they play. Awesome meal. Will be back soon.
author: Daniel S.
